result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard H Wamboldt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

AODA evaluation and followthrough.
Obtain Domestic Violence assessment through a certified (WBTP) Wisconsin batterer's treatment provider and followthrough with all treatment recommendations.
Absolute sobriety.
No Class B establishments.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard H Wamboldt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Richard H Wamboldt
Current: W11030 Hwy 29, Shawano, WI 54166   (Effective: 03-25-2015)
Prior: W11020 Hwy 29, Shawano, WI 54166

Defendant Richard H Wamboldt in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has changed his mind about counsel and wishes to waive.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Court orders a Withheld sentence and 18 months probation with conditions

Defendant Richard H Wamboldt in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Has some money saved for counsel.  Needs more time.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard H Wamboldt in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  Doesn't qualify for PD needs time to hire counsel.  Bond continues with all conditions.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
